016
017package squidpony.squidmath;
018
019import java.util.Arrays;
020
021/** A binary heap that stores nodes which each have a double value and are sorted either lowest first or highest first.
022 * The {@link Node} class can be extended to store additional information.
023 * @author Nathan Sweet */
024@SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
025public class BinaryHeap<T extends BinaryHeap.Node> {
026        public int size;
027
028        private Node[] nodes;
029        private final boolean isMaxHeap;
030
031        public BinaryHeap () {
032                this(16, false);
033        }
034
035        public BinaryHeap (int capacity, boolean isMaxHeap) {
036                this.isMaxHeap = isMaxHeap;
037                nodes = new Node[capacity];
038        }
039
040        /** Adds the node to the heap using its current value. The node should not already be in the heap. */
041        public T add (T node) {
042                // Expand if necessary.
043                if (size == nodes.length) {
044                        Node[] newNodes = new Node[size << 1];
045                        System.arraycopy(nodes, 0, newNodes, 0, size);
046                        nodes = newNodes;
047                }
048                // Insert at end and bubble up.
049                node.index = size;
050                nodes[size] = node;
051                up(size++);
052                return node;
053        }
054
055        /** Sets the node's value and adds it to the heap. The node should not already be in the heap. */
056        public T add (T node, double value) {
057                node.value = value;
058                return add(node);
059        }
060
061        /** Returns true if the heap contains the specified node.
062         * @param identity If true, == comparison will be used. If false, .equals() comparison will be used. */
063        public boolean contains (T node, boolean identity) {
064                if (node == null) throw new IllegalArgumentException("node cannot be null.");
065                if (identity) {
066                        for (Node n : nodes)
067                                if (n == node) return true;
068                } else {
069                        for (Node other : nodes)
070                                if (other.equals(node)) return true;
071                }
072                return false;
073        }
074
075        /** Returns the first item in the heap. This is the item with the lowest value (or highest value if this heap is configured as
076         * a max heap). */
077        public T peek () {
078                if (size == 0) throw new IllegalStateException("The heap is empty.");
079                return (T)nodes[0];
080        }
081
082        /** Removes the first item in the heap and returns it. This is the item with the lowest value (or highest value if this heap is
083         * configured as a max heap). */
084        public T pop () {
085                Node removed = nodes[0];
086                if (--size > 0) {
087                        nodes[0] = nodes[size];
088                        nodes[size] = null;
089                        down(0);
090                } else
091                        nodes[0] = null;
092                return (T)removed;
093        }
094
095        public T remove (T node) {
096                if (--size > 0) {
097                        Node moved = nodes[size];
098                        nodes[size] = null;
099                        nodes[node.index] = moved;
100                        if (moved.value < node.value ^ isMaxHeap)
101                                up(node.index);
102                        else
103                                down(node.index);
104                } else
105                        nodes[0] = null;
106                return node;
107        }
108        
109        /** Returns true if the heap has one or more items. */
110        public boolean notEmpty () {
111                return size > 0;
112        }
113
114        /** Returns true if the heap is empty. */
115        public boolean isEmpty () {
116                return size == 0;
117        }
118
119        public void clear () {
120                Arrays.fill(nodes, 0, size, null);
121                size = 0;
122        }
123
124        /** Changes the value of the node, which should already be in the heap. */
125        public void setValue (T node, double value) {
126                double oldValue = node.value;
127                node.value = value;
128                if (value < oldValue ^ isMaxHeap)
129                        up(node.index);
130                else
131                        down(node.index);
132        }
133
134        private void up (int index) {
135                Node[] nodes = this.nodes;
136                Node node = nodes[index];
137                double value = node.value;
138                while (index > 0) {
139                        int parentIndex = (index - 1) >> 1;
140                        Node parent = nodes[parentIndex];
141                        if (value < parent.value ^ isMaxHeap) {
142                                nodes[index] = parent;
143                                parent.index = index;
144                                index = parentIndex;
145                        } else
146                                break;
147                }
148                nodes[index] = node;
149                node.index = index;
150        }
151
152        private void down (int index) {
153                Node[] nodes = this.nodes;
154                int size = this.size;
155
156                Node node = nodes[index];
157                double value = node.value;
158
159                while (true) {
160                        int leftIndex = 1 + (index << 1);
161                        if (leftIndex >= size) break;
162                        int rightIndex = leftIndex + 1;
163
164                        // Always has a left child.
165                        Node leftNode = nodes[leftIndex];
166                        double leftValue = leftNode.value;
167
168                        // May have a right child.
169                        Node rightNode;
170                        double rightValue;
171                        if (rightIndex >= size) {
172                                rightNode = null;
173                                rightValue = isMaxHeap ? -Double.MAX_VALUE : Double.MAX_VALUE;
174                        } else {
175                                rightNode = nodes[rightIndex];
176                                rightValue = rightNode.value;
177                        }
178
179                        // The smallest of the three values is the parent.
180                        if (leftValue < rightValue ^ isMaxHeap) {
181                                if (leftValue == value || (leftValue > value ^ isMaxHeap)) break;
182                                nodes[index] = leftNode;
183                                leftNode.index = index;
184                                index = leftIndex;
185                        } else {
186                                if (rightValue == value || (rightValue > value ^ isMaxHeap)) break;
187                                nodes[index] = rightNode;
188                                if (rightNode != null) rightNode.index = index;
189                                index = rightIndex;
190                        }
191                }
192
193                while (index > 0) {
194                        int parentIndex = (index - 1) >> 1;
195                        Node parent = nodes[parentIndex];
196                        if (value < parent.value ^ isMaxHeap) {
197                                nodes[index] = parent;
198                                parent.index = index;
199                                index = parentIndex;
200                        } else
201                                break;
202                }
203
204                nodes[index] = node;
205                node.index = index;
206        }
207
208        public boolean equals (Object obj) {
209                if (!(obj instanceof BinaryHeap)) return false;
210                BinaryHeap other = (BinaryHeap)obj;
211                if (other.size != size) return false;
212                Node[] nodes1 = this.nodes, nodes2 = other.nodes;
213                for (int i = 0, n = size; i < n; i++)
214                        if (nodes1[i].value != nodes2[i].value) return false;
215                return true;
216        }
217
218        public int hashCode () {
219                int h = 1;
220                Node[] nodes = this.nodes;
221                for (int i = 0, n = size; i < n; i++)
222                        h = h * 31 + NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(nodes[i].value);
223                return h;
224        }
225
226        public String toString () {
227                if (size == 0) return "[]";
228                Node[] nodes = this.nodes;
229                StringBuilder buffer = new StringBuilder(32);
230                buffer.append('[');
231                buffer.append(nodes[0].value);
232                for (int i = 1; i < size; i++) {
233                        buffer.append(", ");
234                        buffer.append(nodes[i].value);
235                }
236                buffer.append(']');
237                return buffer.toString();
238        }
239
240        /** A binary heap node.
241         * @author Nathan Sweet */
242        public static class Node {
243                public double value;
244                public int index;
245
246                /** @param value The initial value for the node. To change the value, use {@link BinaryHeap#add(Node, double)} if the node is
247                 *           not in the heap, or {@link BinaryHeap#setValue(Node, double)} if the node is in the heap. */
248                public Node (double value) {
249                        this.value = value;
250                }
251
252                public double getValue () {
253                        return value;
254                }
255
256                public String toString () {
257                        return Double.toString(value);
258                }
259        }
260}
